definition: mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)

sentences.english: The closer the relative, the more the pattern of repeats matches.
sentences.chinese: 血緣關係越近，這些重複的模式越相近。

sentences.english: There is no kinship between them, but they two are very close.
sentences.chinese: 他們兩人雖沒有血緣關係，但卻親如膠漆。

sentences.english: The family of Abraham is based upon faith and not fleshly descent.
sentences.chinese: 這是建於信而非血緣關係的基礎上的。

sentences.english: The Indian organ transplantation rules bar government hospitals from conducting kidney transplants if the donor has no blood relation to the patient.
sentences.chinese: 器官移植法禁止政府醫院爲沒血緣關係人士移植腎臟。

sentences.english: We're not related but we can be something else.
sentences.chinese: 我們沒有血緣關係，但我們可以有別的。

sentences.english: Every female within the pride is usually related.
sentences.chinese: 獅羣中的母獅凡是是有血緣關係的。

sentences.english: It's a kind of simulation to the consanguinity obviously.
sentences.chinese: 從其字面上看，它明顯就是血緣關係的一種模擬。

sentences.english: Even if animals are unrelated, they are nice to one another.
sentences.chinese: 即使沒有血緣關係的動物，它們也會友善地對待對方。

sentences.english: The prosperity of the people with a surname of Lee in Longxi has consanguinity with the development of the ancient Qiang nationality.
sentences.chinese: 隴西李氏之興，與古羌族的發展有密切的血緣關係。

definition: to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
(fig.) gulf/chasm/wide gap/(originally) the Hong Canal in Henan, which in ancient times formed the border between enemies Chu 楚 and Han 漢|汉
variant of 抵觸|抵触[di3 chu4]
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
